verses.content: The Lord of all armies will take everything away from Jerusalem and Judah. He will take away all their food and water.
He will take away strong men and soldiers. He will take away judges and prophets. He will take away wise men and old leaders.
He will take away army captains and important men. He will take away advisors, skilled workers, and good speakers.
I will give them children to be their leaders. Babies will rule over them.
People will hurt each other. Everyone will hurt their neighbor. Children will be rude to old people. Bad people will act proud against good people.
A man will grab his brother in his father's house. He will say: "You have clothes. Be our leader! Don't let this broken city be your problem."
That day the brother will say: "I cannot fix things. I have no food or clothes in my house. Don't make me a leader of the people."
Jerusalem is destroyed, and Judah has fallen. Their words and actions have been against the Lord. They have made his glory angry.
Their faces show their sin. They show their sin like Sodom did. They cannot hide it. How terrible for them! They have brought evil on themselves.
Tell good people that things will go well for them. They will get the good results of what they do.
How terrible for bad people! They will die. What their hands have done will happen to them.
My people, children hurt them and women rule over them. My people, your leaders make you go the wrong way. They destroy your paths.
The Lord stands up to argue his case. He stands to judge the people.
The Lord will judge the old leaders and rulers of his people. "You have destroyed the vineyard. Things you stole from the poor are in your houses."
"What are you doing? You beat my people to pieces. You crush the faces of the poor," says the Lord God of armies.
The Lord also says: "The daughters of Zion are proud. They walk with their necks stretched out and eyes that flirt. They walk with tiny steps and make their ankles jingle."
So the Lord will put sores on the heads of Zion's daughters. The Lord will make them lose their hair.
In that day the Lord will take away their beautiful ankle chains, headbands, and moon-shaped necklaces.
He will take away their chains, bracelets, and veils.
He will take away their hats, ankle jewelry, sashes, perfume bottles, and lucky charms.
He will take away their rings and nose rings.
He will take away their fancy clothes, capes, shawls, and purses.
He will take away their mirrors, fine clothes, turbans, and veils.

Instead of sweet perfume, there will be a bad smell. Instead of a belt, there will be a rope. Instead of styled hair, they will be bald. Instead of fancy clothes, they will wear rough cloth. Instead of beauty, there will be burns.
Your men will die by the sword. Your strong men will die in war.
The city gates will cry and be sad. The city will be empty and sit on the ground.
